intro: Korthalsella remyi, commonly known as the Zambian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Korthalsella remyi is a perennial herb with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in botanical gardens and collections.
